body:
I likely means your video has some corrupted frames; can you open it with openCV; and, as you can see we have several video readers in the code, Check out the docstring, and perhaps play around with those options. 

i.e., this is not a "feature" of DLC; I assure you we have processed millions of frames without issue in my lab ;).

@dervinism, you could also use the following to detect corrupted frames in your video:
```
from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import VideoReader

vid = VideoReader('path_to_your_video')
vid.check_integrity()
```
This will raise a warning if some errors are found as your video frames are inspected and write a log file with some more info.

Unfortunately I get the following error:

from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import VideoReader
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<ipython-input-3-e80735ff3226>", line 2, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import VideoReader

ImportError: cannot import name 'VideoReader' from 'deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos' (C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\auxfun_videos.py)

Your deeplabcut 2.2b8 DLC-GPU.yaml file should state
```
- pip:
    - deeplabcut==2.2b8
```
rather than
```
- pip:
    - deeplabcut
```
VideoReader also requires ffmpeg being installed.

This is the content of the log file generated after the integrity check on the above video file with two missing frames:
```
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e9cf5d80] unsupported marker 0x6A70 at pos 0x4
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e9cf5d80] unsupported marker 0x78DD at pos 0x3269
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e9cf5d80] unsupported marker 0x98AA at pos 0xA8DB
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e9cf5d80] unsupported marker 0xE128 at pos 0xF22F
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e9cf5d80] unsupported marker 0xD5E7 at pos 0x115A3
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e9cf5d80] Invalid len 8422 left=2510
Error while decoding stream #0:0: Invalid data found when processing input
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e7d85440] unsupported marker 0x6A70 at pos 0x4
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e7d85440] unsupported marker 0x0F91 at pos 0x3269
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e7d85440] unsupported marker 0xDB16 at pos 0xA833
[jpeg2000 @ 00000282e7d85440] Invalid len 46714 left=23769
Error while decoding stream #0:0: Invalid data found when processing input
```
Would you be able to help with the interpretation of this output? Or perhaps you could point me to documentation that address the logging output. Thanks

Thanks for the link. Do you know how to locate the corrupted frames as the error codes seem not to indicate the frame number? Unless len, left, or pos parameters somehow indicate it but I cannot find them being explained.

Just as a side note, I think it would be much more convenient if the corrupted frames were flagged by deeplabcut during the video analysis by a line of NaNs corresponding to the frame location. Or if not, output lines in the csv file could be labeled by an actual frame number.
Opening videos with corrupted frames and saving them using a video editor like Adobe Premierre or Shotcut seems to fix the corrupted frames. This is one way to solve this issue.

issue.title: Missing most of my video for DeepLabCut after video Analysis step

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I ran a 6 minute long video through the DeepLabCut program, Colab_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb. Every step worked fine, until I got to the end and saw that the labeled video was only 1 second long, the first second of the original video. I noticed that during the analysis step, the number of frames went down from 23512 to 58, and I don’t know why this happened.

Below is the following code that was generated. Below that is my config file for any additional information that might be needed. I have never ran into this issue before, please let me know if there are any fixes for this.

issue.body:
OS: Windows10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2
Anaconda env used: DLC-GPU

Problem:

When I try to analyze videos with a trained model, it only analyzes a small percentage of each video (usually 10-12%). The videos I have are rather large: 1920 x 1080, but I changed the max input size to 2500. The only other thing I can think of is that I did have to decrease global scale to 0.7 for training, so as to not overload my GPU with the larger videos. 

Thank you so much for your help!

```python
Plots created! Please check the directory "plot-poses" within the video directory
```

**How to Reproduce the problem**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Trained model using 300 frames, 200,000 iterations, resnet-50 base model
2. Clicked on Analyze Videos tab in GUI
3. Selected a video to analyze
4. Checked boxes to: 1) save results as csv, 2) filter predictions, 3) plot trajectories, 4) create labeled videos.
5. Clicked 'Run'
6. Code ran to completion, but only 12% of video was analyzed
(Videos are about 8 seconds; 1920 x 1080p; 120 fps)

issue.title: Analyzing video doesn't succeed

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using. Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x. Please complete the following information about your system: OS: Windows 8.1 Pro DeepLabCut Version: 2.2 Anaconda env used: Anaconda prompt 3, GPU, ipython **Describe the problem** I made 3 different trials for the same video. At first I thought the number of iterations were too low, so I left the program run with 100.000 iterations to make sure that wasn't the problem. However, when I analyze the video, the full.mp4 file video shows tracking for around 1-2 seconds and then it disappears. It happened for all the previous trials. Of course this leads to empty tracklets or 1-2 seconds tracking when refining them. Any solution? I don't know if this could be useful, but when I tried to plot the maps, I got another error on the way. I'll post both error. P.S. I'm not much familiar with coding, this is part of a training for a research internship Please place code inside this: Error in plotting maps

[00:54<00:00, 25.15it/s] ]

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to 'Analyze video' 2. Click on 'Select video' (.mp4) 3. Click Step 1: analyze video 4. Click Step 2: convert into tracklets 5. When proceeding to refining tracklets, I launch GUI and I can only see/refine 1-2 seconds of the video (with less iteration, 20.000 for instance, I could not even see this and the "OSError: tracklets are empty" error showed up) **Screenshots** ![Screenshot (8)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75975343/102067968-1d721200-3dfc-11eb-91d8-2db409fe8f5d.png) ![Screenshot (9)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75975343/102067983-24008980-3dfc-11eb-8b44-cd37f244b703.png) **Additional context** I hope I filled in the form in the right way and gave enough information

issue.title: Analyze_videos not analyzing all frames from the video

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Problem: 

I am running the deeplabcut.analyze_videos function on multiple videos and for some reason it is not analyzing all frames. It extracted posture up to 63% in one example, and said that it detected 54558/86679 frames. 

Additional info: training this network took about 7 days (200,000 iterations). 

Any ideas what could be going wrong here?


Thanks,
-Roberto

issue.title: OSError: Tracklets are empty.

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I've previously run `deeplabcut.analyze_videos()` on these samples and they labeled with acceptable accuracy.  Now when I tried to run the function on the same videos I'm getting the tracklet error.

I used `vid.check_integrity()` as referenced in the @jeylau comment in #982-- the videos aren't corrupt.
I looked through all the github issue tickets related to this problem but none of them address the issue: as aforementioned, the videos are in working condition.

### Operating System

Google Colab

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.1

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Google Colab Pro GPU

### Steps To Reproduce

```
deeplabcut.analyze_videos(path_config_file,videofile_path, videotype=VideoType, save_as_csv = True)
```

### Relevant log output

```shell
Using snapshot-20000 for model /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/dlc-models/iteration-0/Trial9May23-trainset95shuffle1
Activating extracting of PAFs
Analyzing all the videos in the directory...
Starting to analyze %  /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4
Loading  /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4
Duration of video [s]:  30.27 , recorded with  30.0 fps!
Overall # of frames:  908  found with (before cropping) frame dimensions:  1920 1080
Starting to extract posture from the video(s) with batchsize: 8
100%|██████████| 908/908 [01:35<00:00,  9.52it/s]
Video Analyzed. Saving results in /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos...
Using snapshot-20000 for model /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/dlc-models/iteration-0/Trial9May23-trainset95shuffle1
Processing...  /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4
Analyzing /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_TrimDLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_20000.h5
100%|██████████| 908/908 [00:01<00:00, 678.29it/s]
908it [00:00, 133934.52it/s]
The tracklets were created (i.e., under the hood deeplabcut.convert_detections2tracklets was run). Now you can 'refine_tracklets' in the GUI, or run 'deeplabcut.stitch_tracklets'.
Processing...  /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
OSError                                   Traceback (most recent call last)
[<ipython-input-22-00093eb97f4f>](https://localhost:8080/#) in <module>()
----> 1 deeplabcut.analyze_videos(path_config_file,videofile_path, videotype=VideoType, save_as_csv = True)

4 frames
[/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/predict_videos.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in analyze_videos(config, videos, videotype, shuffle, trainingsetindex, gputouse, save_as_csv, destfolder, batchsize, cropping, TFGPUinference, dynamic, modelprefix, robust_nframes, allow_growth, use_shelve, auto_track, n_tracks, calibrate, identity_only, use_openvino)
    587                         destfolder=destfolder,
    588                         n_tracks=n_tracks,
--> 589                         modelprefix=modelprefix,
    590                     )
    591         else:

[/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in stitch_tracklets(config_path, videos, videotype, shuffle, trainingsetindex, n_tracks, min_length, split_tracklets, prestitch_residuals, max_gap, weight_func, destfolder, modelprefix, track_method, output_name, transformer_checkpoint)

   1158             stitcher = TrackletStitcher.from_pickle(
-> 1159                 pickle_file, n_tracks, min_length, split_tracklets, prestitch_residuals
   1160             )
   1161             with_id = any(tracklet.identity != -1 for tracklet in stitcher)

[/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in from_pickle(cls, pickle_file, n_tracks, min_length, split_tracklets, prestitch_residuals)

--> 510             tracklets, n_tracks, min_length, split_tracklets, prestitch_residuals
    511         )
    512         class_.filename = pickle_file

OSError: Tracklets are empty.
```

### Anything else?

I can provide a Google Drive folder with the pertinent files if needed.

issue.title: Update COLAB_YOURDATA_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body: Add a section to troubleshoot novel video analysis issues such as tracking of only a relatively small number of frames #982.

issue.title: Update COLAB_YOURDATA_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Added a section to troubleshoot novel video analysis issues such as tracking of only a relatively small number of frames.
#982
